all_paragraphs: This article highlights how small and medium-sized businesses can use a predictive approach to forecast customer behavior. Businesses must earn the loyalty of their customers and reduce churn rate.

The aim is to help offline merchants (specifically small and medium businesses) better understand their customers, reduce their churn rate, and increase customer loyalty to the brand. With several product options such as loyalty and pickup options, merchants can identify their best customers and know how best to engage them.

This article entails a combination of machine learning, data analysis, and programming. Information on customers and their orders will be reviewed, and any distinct segment or trend will be identified.

Customer loyalty and retention are critical to the growth of any business. Offline merchants (specifically small and medium stores) struggle to offer personalized services to their customers. In the same vein, customers expect to be treated with the same engagement as major brands such as Netflix, Amazon, and others. With a myriad of options for customers to pick from, these businesses have to evolve or risk being left behind.
What are the personalization challenges that small businesses face?
Small and medium merchants do not have enough resources to gather and interpret customer data. Some of their challenges include;

Customer churn or customer attrition refers to the tendency for a customer to stop patronizing a brand or business. Correlation Matrix Plot Between Significant Variables of Active Customers

Correlation depicts the similar changes between two variables. When this change happens in the same direction, it is considered a positive correlation. If the changes occur in a different direction, it is considered a negative correlation.
To put it simply, Correlation Matrix is the correlation between each pair of attributes. It can be plotted on a graph to discern the degree of correlation between several variables.

This calculation is is useful to know, because some machine learning algorithms like linear and logistic regression can have poor performance if there are highly correlated input variables in your data

Above, the matrix can be seen as being symmetrical, i.e., the bottom left, and top right of the matrix are identical. Also, it displays 6 different views on the same data in a single plot. It can also be inferred that the strongest correlated variable is between the final price (total spending) and earned points. This is a positive correlation — the higher the final price a customer can attain in this data set, the higher their earning points. However, other variables do not share this same correlation. Yet, they provide useful information and work on the same fundamental principle.

Machine learning is predominantly built on the concept of making predictions and classification. However, the most important thing to understand is that it isn’t about how fancy a method is, but its compatibility with the test data.

When predicting, it is vital to select only the most important attributes needed for the predicted outcome. Also, the appropriate ML method has to be chosen. Regarding customer discussions, the following suggestions are recommended:

Recommendation and Customer Segmentation of loyalty campaigns such as bonus rewards, points top-up, free tier upgrade, and specifically optimized reward programs that boost revenues and ROI. Therefore, customers were segmented to discover the best group.

Segmentation is vital to wide scale personalization. Moreover, the system should analyze the data of like-minded users that share no direct correlation to other users but share the same criteria in search and purchasing patterns (with the aid of ML algorithms to offer more detail and show similarities between user profiles).
Sales Prediction can be used to predict the volume of future sales. By analyzing further, data such as sales per store, sales per category, and sales per product can be deduced.
Lifetime Value Prediction can be used to identify the most appropriate customers based on segmented customers and behavior patterns.
Churn Prediction can be used to determine the amount of churn within a specified period.
